revised_title: Anatomy and Affinities of Fossil Belemnites
tldr: The author examines fossilized Belemnites found in the Oxford clay at Christian Malford, Wilts, and describes the preservation of their soft parts. He discusses the structure of the shell, the phragmocone, and the mantle, as well as the muscular fibers and organs of the Belemnite. The author concludes that Belemnites share characteristics with various existing genera, such as Sepia, Spirula, Onychoteuthis, and Rossia, and that they represent a unique combination of features.
